TEXT.TITLE: CCC GUARANTEES TO TURKEY SWITCHED TO MEALS-USDA
TEXT.BODY: The Commodity Credit Corporation, CCC, has reallocated 15.0 mln dlrs in credit guarantees to Turkey previously earmarked for sales of U.S. oilseeds to provide coverage for sales of U.S. protein meals in fiscal year 1987, the U.S. Agriculture Department said. The department said the action reduces the guarantee line authorized for sales of oilseeds to 5.0 mln dlrs from 20.0 mln dlrs and creates the new line for protein meals. All sales under the credit lines must be registered and exports completed by September 30, 1987, it said. Reuter
